function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Fragmented research on the interaction between COVID-19, housing policies, and green housing may lead to incomplete understanding of the components.","Impact":"Inadequate understanding may result in ineffective strategies for mitigating disease propagation and promoting resident wellbeing.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive investigation to gain a deeper understanding of the three components and their interactions.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, modeling software, and research databases for comprehensive analysis.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, and urban planners.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, and urban planning organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of micro-level (building) and macro-level (city, country) aspects of green housing during and after the COVID-19 era may result in ineffective housing policies.","Impact":"Ineffective policies may lead to increased risk of disease propagation and negatively impact resident wellbeing.","Mitigation":"Consider both micro-level and macro-level aspects when developing housing policies, integrate health-related amenities, and prioritize green infrastructure.","Technologies":"Building information modeling (BIM) software, GIS mapping tools, and health impact assessment models.","People":"Urban planners, architects, and policymakers.","Owner":"Government agencies, housing authorities, and urban planning organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of emphasis on crisis-response measures, support for tenants and owners, and recovery strategies in housing policies may increase the risk of disease propagation and affect resident wellbeing.","Impact":"Inadequate support and recovery strategies may lead to housing insecurity, overcrowding, and limited access to health services, contributing to disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Include crisis-response measures, tenant support programs, and recovery strategies in housing policies to ensure resilience and wellbeing of residents.","Technologies":"Housing management software, community resilience modeling, and data analytics for housing trends.","People":"Government agencies, housing authorities, and community organizations.","Owner":"Local government, housing authorities, and community development organizations."}]}
